isis.stitle: Spanish - Guía para Localización de Fallas del Sistema Eléctrico - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - ANTILOCK AIR BRAKE SYSTEM WITH TRACTION CONTROL: BENDIX - 9200, 9300 and 9400 - COMPONENT FAILURE - VOLTAGE SUPPLY

svcproc.title: VOLTAGE SUPPLY
svcproc.para: If the voltage supply to the controller is out of range (11-17 VDC), the system is disabled and the vehicle reverts to standard braking. If the voltage returns to the proper range, the ABS and traction control are restored.

note.para: A voltage problem can correct itself. For example, if a power surge (or droop) causes the voltage to go out of the acceptable range (11-17 VDC) for a moment, the voltage LED will flash. But when voltage returns to acceptable limits, the LED goes out and ABS and traction control are restored.
